page.title: 09Thorney Play Areas
page.content: { Thorney}has plenty of{play areas}but not enough{equipment.}We have 3 small {play areas}on the newest estate, {Chestnut Drive}and{The Maltings,}but nothing on them. There is one{play {area}at the bottom of{Sandpit Road with just 2 swings. Thorney has its own park with 6 swings, 1 slide, and 1 see-saw. For adults there are tennis courts.{Thorney}children want more equipment! I interviewed{Mr Hogg,}my teacher.}He has joined the{'Thorney {Play Space Group'.}Other parents got together in{April}to discuss the lack of play areas. They decided that more equipment was needed. They now have to discover what the rest of the village think before exploring ways of raising money. Many children are at present busy designing their own equipment, and an{architect}is coming to a {coffee morning}to look at the designs.
